snippet: An inspection team from the United Nations’ nuclear agency will visit Libya to assess the thousands of barrels of yellowcake uranium that reportedly are being stored at a former military site amid a “precarious” security situation in the...
abstract: United Nations says inspection team from its nuclear agency will visit Libya to assess the thousands of barrels of yellowcake uranium that reportedly are being stored at a former military site amid a 'precarious' security situation in the country.
lead_paragraph: An inspection team from the United Nations’ nuclear agency will visit Libya to assess the thousands of barrels of yellowcake uranium that reportedly are being stored at a former military site amid a “precarious” security situation in the country, a United Nations official said.
